Params: {1: '1', 3: 'Her vision is blurry. Her head feels heavy, as if she has just surfaced from deep underwater. The suffocating weight of near-drowning clings to her. Shapes sway around her. Slowly, one becomes clear—a girl with long hair.'}
{3: 'She stands in a shaft of morning light, the edges of her hair glowing gold.'}
{3: 'A sudden jolt snaps her body into motion, instincts taking over.'}
{3: 'The familiar girl giggles as if at a joke, stopping Discord from pulling out her IV and getting up.'}
{2: 'Girl', 3: "This is Babylonia. There's no work for you here.", 4: '2'}
{3: "The girl looks just as puzzled, but keeps moving. She pulls back the off-white curtains to let in more sunlight, then tucks a soft cushion behind Discord's back."}
{3: 'Once done, she returns to the bedside.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Girl', 3: "You've been retired for a long time now, sis.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Discord struggles to process her words, unsure if it\'s being called "sis" that stuns her, or if it\'s the word "retired" catching in her throat like a fishbone.'}
{3: 'The girl quickly hides the troubled look that comes with having to contradict her, replacing it with the calm smile of someone used to these reactions.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Girl', 3: "Another beautiful morning! It's breakfast time. Come on.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The girl deftly produces a tray of light food, served in identical small insulated containers.'}

{3: 'Steaming oatmeal sprinkled with a pinch of cinnamon—easy to swallow, with no pulp or residue. Brightly colored boiled carrot cubes and baked vegetables, clearly chosen for balanced nutrition...'}
{3: 'Beside them, smooth pale-yellow mashed potatoes covered in light gravy, and finally, dessert—a small cherry-topped cake?'}
{3: 'That same cloying, speckled frosting as always.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Girl', 3: "You're not supposed to eat sweets anymore. But this cherry cake? I saved it for you.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The familiar colors and scents stimulate her senses. Discord squints, enduring the tingling in her mind as she recalls sharing this exact meal she ate countless times before—with someone.'}
{3: 'Against the backdrop of this cherry cake, the date counter on the wall keeps ticking upward.'}
{3: 'Finally, the cream melts away and the crimson fruit falls, releasing the scent of rot.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Girl', 3: "Don't tell me... you've forgotten my name again? I'm Lilith.", 4: '1'}
{3: "The girl presses the spoon into Discord's hand, her expression shifting from playful reproach to the patient gentleness one shows a patient."}
{3: 'Confused by the strange safety she feels, Discord pauses, the cream-tipped spoon hovering at her lips.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lilith', 3: 'No appetite? You should still try to eat something.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: "No... that's not right. Your name is...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Melancholy washes over Discord as she searches for a mirror to glimpse herself. Is she gravely ill? Dying? Or has she been cast aside yet again, her usefulness spent?'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Eleanor', 3: "So you don't even remember who I am now? I suppose that's to be expected.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: "No, that's not right! You just called me sis...", 4: '1'}

{3: 'Discord struggles to her feet, scanning the room for the mirror that would show her the truth and shatter the lie. The only thing on the wall is a peaceful pastoral painting—blue sky, white clouds—its colors melting into one another until they are nothing but indistinct blotches.'}
{3: "She can't look away. The blotches start to run, pigment dripping to the floor and onto her own hands, which have become cracked and withered."}
{3: 'The soft curtains stir in the breeze, casting shifting shadows across the room. A faint, pleasant scent lingers in the air, mixed with the sharp tang of antiseptic.'}
{3: 'Is this Babylonia too? The deathly silence only serves to remind her how ridiculous her unease really is.'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: "You have degenerative memory loss. Your memories get mixed up, and sometimes you can't even remember what happened a few minutes ago...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'We go through conversations like this several times every morning.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'Do you want me to explain again how to slow this kind of central nervous system degeneration?', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Eleanor', 3: "You need good habits, a balanced diet, and light exercise. But even the finest clinic in Babylonia can't reverse it. The aphasia, the apraxia, the agnosia—they will keep returning.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Discord freezes completely. The bedsheet under her hands is wrinkled deep from how hard she has been gripping it.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Eleanor', 3: "Sometimes you'll get angry. You'll see things that aren't there. You'll forget the past. You might even mistake me for your enemy.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: "But that's alright. I'll take care of everything for you. Because I am your █▅█▊, Lilith.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: "No... no, that's not possible. How could I be your...?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Discord', 3: "We're companions. You're my reason to live. My..."}
{3: 'Images flicker and fade, leaving her caught between dream and waking.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Eleanor', 3: "Maybe it was the movie we watched last night that's making you feel like this.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'In the movie, high-ranking officers planted false memories in soldiers—childhood sweethearts always by their side, siblings with unbreakable bonds, or goals so important they would stake their lives on them.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'Those beautiful illusions kept them fighting for a hundred days straight.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'And when they learned the truth, they had the same empty look you do right now.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'Maybe, in your dreams, you were fighting just as hard to protect me too?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Time and again, she followed orders, plummeting from great heights with crushing force.'}
{3: 'Chains coiled around her throat, cutting off her breath. She gripped her weapon, slick with blood, as the hounds leaped at her with murderous force.'}
{3: 'Gunfire hounded her. Smoke chased her through the dim concrete. She crawled like a trapped animal, ragged breaths of the barely-surviving echoing in her ears.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'Then what is your reason to fight?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Eleanor', 3: "Orders? No, you're wrong. We're mother and daughter, sisters. Our bond is selfless and close. How could something so cold as orders hold it together?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Discord', 3: 'No, that was only what I wished for.', 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Eleanor', 3: "We shared a wonderful life, growing up together. You worked in a tailor's shop, became my personal seamstress, until we came to Babylonia and grew old... You used to tell me life passes in the blink of an eye.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'If you mean what can be smelled, tasted, touched, seen—those are only processed electronic signals.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: "Emotion is humanity's greatest weakness. So many people spend their lives chasing pleasure, seeking comfort in virtual worlds fed straight into their brains...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'If you believe real feelings can be woven into clothes, hidden in a doll, or engraved on a dog tag, why can\'t they exist inside your "mind" too?', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'I know your wounds, your desires, your dreams. They abandoned you. Some saw you as a stand-in for a lost partner, some as a necessary sacrifice for their ideals, some as penance to wash away their sins...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: "But I'm different. I see you as a person. You want to be loved, so I...", 4: '1'}
{3: "Lilith pulls her into an embrace. Her cheek rests on the girl's shoulder, long hair curling around her nose."}
{3: 'Light from the window wraps them in layers of gold.'}
{1: '"All the things that warm the soul and calm the mind are sealed within memory and the self."', 3: '45'}
{3: '"All the things that warm the soul and calm the mind are sealed within memory and the self."'}
{1: '"I give them to you, though you have no time to understand them."', 3: '45'}
{3: '"I give them to you, though you have no time to understand them."'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'Forget the mission. You can have your own life beyond duty.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: "The war ended long ago. There's no need to fight anymore. We've already begun our new life together.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: 'I play the Tannhauser Overture on the piano every day while you accompany me.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Eleanor', 3: "You're a part of me, so I know. Your wish is to live peacefully, relying on your own craft, isn't it?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She stares at the blank window beyond the curtains. Thread-like cracks begin to spider across the glass.'}
